trans-unit.source: Represents a WS-Federation Attribute Request message.
This message is created when the wa parameter in the received message is "wattr1.0".
For more information about the message that this class represents, see the WS-Federation specification.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.AttributeRequestMessage"></xref> class with the specified base URL.
The wa message parameter (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.Action%2A> property) is initialized to "wattr1.0".
The base URL to which this message applies.
Gets or sets the wattr parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wattr parameter from the message.
A string that contains the value of the wattr parameter.
Gets or sets the wattrptr parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wattrptr parameter from the message.
A string that contains the value of the wattrptr parameter.
An attempt to set a value that is not a valid URI occurs.
Gets or sets the wreply parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wreply parameter from the message.
A string that contains the value of the wreply parameter.
This is the URL to which the reply should be sent.
An attempt to set a value that is not a valid URI occurs.
Gets or sets the wresult parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wresult parameter from the message.
A string that contains the value of the wresult parameter.
Gets or sets the wresultptr parameter of the message.
Set to `null` or an empty string to remove the wresultptr parameter from the message.
A string that contains the value of the wresultptr parameter.
An attempt to set a value that is not a valid URI occurs.
No validation is performed by the framework.
Users of this class should validate externally.
No validation is performed by the framework.
Users of this class should validate externally.

For example, you may want to check that both the wresult parameter (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.AttributeRequestMessage.Result%2A> property) and the wresultptr parameter (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.AttributeRequestMessage.ResultPtr%2A> property) are not set in the same message.
Writes the message in query string form to the specified text writer.
This method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.AttributeRequestMessage.Validate%2A> method before writing the message.
The writer to which to write the message.
writer is `null`.
